removeBlob

public BHCompoundBlob removeBlob(int label)
Removes an element specified by label - returns the element that was removed and replaces its location with null. Note that this is different than the "remove" methods for Vector which do not perform the replacement.

Parameters:
label - The label of the blob to remove
Returns:
the BHCompoundBlob element that was removed (and replaced by null);

public int getLabelIndex(int theLabel)

Parameters:
theLabel - the label to find the location of.
Returns:
a zero-based index of the label's location, if not found then -1 is returned

combine

public void combine(int[] labelList)
Merge (via combine(one, two)) the list of blobs into the first listed in the argument. For example... merge({3,6,11}) will add blobs 6 and 11 to 3.

Parameters:
labelList - the list of label indices to combine

Parameters:
one - the label of the first blob
two - the label of the second blob

public void addContour(BHPolygon c)
Adds a contour - the contour already contains its own inside/outside flag so the blob will store it properly. If the blob at [label] is does not exists it will be created.

ys - the origin of the original image in pixels
w - the width of the original image in pixles
h - the height of the original image in pixels

computeMinimumDistanceTable

public double[][] computeMinimumDistanceTable()
Computes the minimum distances separating the outside contour(s) of the each blob - returns a double[][] that is only 1/2 populated (since distance from A to B is the same as B to A). The returned is just like a distance table on a road map. The diagonal is always 0. NOTE - the returned array is [nblob][nblob] not [size][size]thus where blobs don't exists (null). Use getLabels() to retrieve the labels associated with each row/column

filterByArea

public void filterByArea(double minArea,
                         double maxArea)
Removes items that are smaller / bigger than the area specified

Parameters:
minArea - the inclusive minimum area or 0.0, Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY or Double.NaN if no lower limit.
maxArea - the inclusive maximum area or Double.NaN Double.MAX_VALUE, or Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if no upper limit

filterByCirc

public void filterByCirc(double minCirc,
                         double maxCirc)
Removes items that are smaller / bigger than the Circ specified

Parameters:
minCirc - the inclusive minimum Circ or 0.0, Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY or Double.NaN if no lower limit.
maxCirc - the inclusive maximum Circ or Double.NaN Double.MAX_VALUE, or Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if no upper limit

checkRange

public double[] checkRange(double a,
                           double b,
                           double A,
                           double B)
Checks the input values a, b and returns A and B if a or B are NaN or infinite

Parameters:
a - the lower range value
b - the upper range value
A - the replacement for a if it is NaN or infinite
B - the replacement for b if it is NaN or infinite
Returns:
a two element range value

checkRange

public double[] checkRange(double a,
                           double b)
Checks the input values a, b and returns 0.0 or Double.MAX_VALUE for either if they are NaN or infinite

removeIfTouchingEdge

public void removeIfTouchingEdge(int w,
                                 int h,
                                 int edge1,
                                 int edge2,
                                 int edge3,
                                 int edge4)
Remove if touching the specified side, caller can specify up to 4 sides to test - or less than four using BHBlob.NONE as the pass through value.

Parameters:
w - the width of the image
h - the height of the image
edge1 - a bit-style flag of the first side not to touch.
edge2 - a bit-style flag of the second side not to touch.
edge3 - a bit-style flag of the third side not to touch.
edge4 - a bit-style flag of the fourth side not to touch.

KEY: 0 = BHBlob.NONE, 1 = LEFT, 2 = TOP, 4 = RIGHT, 8 = BOTTOM or some combination of these.

For example... group.removeIfTouchingEdge(640, 480, BHBlob.RIGHT, BHBlob.BOTTOM, BHBlob.NONE, BHBlob.NONE);

removeAllButLargest

public void removeAllButLargest()
Eliminates all particles but the one with the largest area In the event of a tie, the first is retained

computeVolume

public void computeVolume(int theLabel)
Calls the computeVolume method for specified BHCompoundBlob

Parameters:
theLabel - the label identfier

computeVolume

public void computeVolume()
Calls the computeVolume method for each constituent BHCompoundBlob

setVolumeMethod

public void setVolumeMethod(int theLabel,
                            int theMethod)
Sets the volume computation method for the specified blob

Parameters:
theLabel - the label ID of the blob
theMethod - See BHBlob for possible values like VOL_SVW, VOL_AUTO, ...

setVolumeMethod

public void setVolumeMethod(int method)
Sets the volume computation method for each compound blob

Parameters:
method - See BHBlob for possible values like VOL_SVW, VOL_AUTO, ...
